title.narrative: Human rights and the 2030 Agenda for Sustainable Development: a cooperation w. URG and DIHR

description.narrative: In order to take forward the initiative by Denmark and other States on leveraging the links between human rights and the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) – especially in the context of strengthened implementation, follow-up, monitoring and reporting – the Permanent Mission of Denmark in Geneva, the Danish Institute for Human Rights (DIHR) and the Universal Rights Group (URG) cooperated on a range of activities. These activities were designed to be practical and operational, to enable States and other key stakeholders to share experience, good practice and lessons learnt in integrated implementing, monitoring and reporting on their international sustainable development and human rights commitments and obligations, with a particular focus on the pledge to “leave no one behind”. The activities explored benefits from the synergies between the SDGs and human rights on the ground, with an emphasis on communities of practice and regional platforms.
